meanings.definition: The circulating life force whose existence and properties are the basis of much Chinese philosophy and medicine.
meanings.sent1: She believed in the power of qi to keep her healthy.
meanings.sent2: In traditional Chinese medicine, practitioners focus on balancing qi in the body.
meanings.sent3: The acupuncturist joked that her qi was so strong, she could lift a feather with her mind.
meanings.sent4: His positive energy was like a warm qi flowing through the room, lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The ancient texts described qi as a gentle breeze that brings life to all living things.

meanings.definition: Energy flow that is essential for health and well-being in traditional Chinese medicine.
meanings.sent1: After the acupuncture treatment, she felt a surge of qi throughout her body.
meanings.sent2: The herbal tea was believed to help restore balance to the body's qi.
meanings.sent3: The yoga instructor reminded her students to focus on their qi while holding the tree pose.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude seemed to radiate a calming qi that put everyone at ease.
meanings.sent5: The qi of the forest was so strong, it felt like a healing embrace to all who entered.
